ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to solve problems in game theory and learned about new game theory principles such as Shapley Values.
The class covers Cooperative Game Theory but also wider applications of game theory.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think the course could do with a more structured flow from topic to topic. Also, lecture notes were scattered and with several errors. In general, organization was an issue.

This course was good in that the assignments and exam were good assessments of what we learned in class. However, it was difficult to learn at times because of the weekly classes and long lectures, and the course would benefit from a TF. Material was disorganized and difficult to review.

The course is not super well designed but you will have fun. Youll learn a lot & the topics are SUPER interesting. Again, it is super disorganized and hard to find what you need to do a question on a problem set, but in the search you subconsciously learn. also the prof is a goat and so fun. loved this class, it was a perfect way to end Yale.
This is a great senior seminar course for students looking for a lighter workload. The content is not the easiest and the three psets take a decent amount of time but nothing too crazy.

Strength: material
Weakness: It was hard to keep track of the different theorems we learned and where they were in the notes.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: It's a relative gut for an ECON seminar.
It's a fine enough class to fill out your senior econ requirement, but if you're expecting a rigorous and structured approach to learning advanced game theory, you will be disappointed.
I would not recommend this course to another student unless they love game theory (specifically thinking about economic theory, not applications). It is too disorganized to learn effectively.

ABSOLUTELY. this class was SO fun and I learned a lot, even though the workload is so small (3 psets, a midterm, and a final paper). youll be confused, the class is very disorganized, but its such such a good class. Hes extremely helpful, cares so much about the set up of the class and making sure were learning. TAKE IT
Yes, for second semester seniors especially.
